bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, September 19, 1896

div1.p: Reed describes his vacation and bicycling. He comments on the upcoming presidential election.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, September 19, 1896

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
September 19, '96

div1.p:
Upon my re=
turn to the city from my annual
vacation I find your sweet let-
ter of congratulation upon my
45th birth-day- I had received
a previous letter from you, but
through unheard-of careless-
ness had neglected to an-
swer it- I was very busy
though, at the time, but this
was no sufficient excuse.
I have been up in the mountains
for several weeks, enjoying
a much needed rest of mind
& body- was pretty well run
down and couldn't work
with any degree of interest-
I have gained 10 lbs and have
the appetite of a “digger” Indian-
Every day, when the weather
would permit, I was on
my wheel riding over Moun-
tains and through valleys-
What a wonderful machine
it is! Do you ride? Of course
you do! Emily & Blossom ride
very well-Washington's Streets
are so inviting that one
can hardly resist the
temptation- Am so glad
that you sent Kit's address
I had mislaid it and couldn't
write to him - Why did he
leave Wichita? No wonder
that he feels lonely- I
heard that he was going
to marry again. Is that true?
I should have thought that
with his honorable position
& reputation in Wichita that
he would have remained
for the balance of his days.
Can you read my writing?
I find that I “left my specks
at home”, this morning, so
that I am terribly handi-
capped- Getting old- no doubt
about that question-
How are you going to vote?
The “High-U-muck-a-muck”
of the Silver forces speaks
here, this afternoon- [I am
not voting, this year, but if I
were, I would vote for the other
fellow- Limit of space forbids
giving my reasons]- I regard
him as dreadfully visionary-
He'll get snowed under, this
fall- Mark my prognosis-
Give lots of love to Nita &
the other children from us
all-
